====== LEDE v17.01.0 Changelog ======

This changelog lists all commits done in LEDE since the creation of the LEDE project, grouped by subsystem.
The changes are chronologically ordered from top to bottom and cover the Git repository history until the tagging of the final 17.01.0 release. 

For a list of changes since the 17.01.0-rc2 release, please refer to the [[releases:17.01:changelog-17.01.0-final|v17.01.0-final changelog]].

==== Build System / Buildroot (309 changes) ====

===== Security fixes ====
=== CVE-2012-6702 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>Expat, when used in a parser that has not called XML_SetHashSalt or passed it a seed of 0, makes it easier for context-dependent attackers to defeat cryptographic protection mechanisms via vectors involving use of the srand function.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2012-6702]]\\
**Commits:**\\
''[[https://git.lede-project.org/?p=source.git;a=commitdiff;h=bf567363cd98dd36ffef7312afc066b14bb9237f|bf56736]]'' **<nowiki>tools/expat:</nowiki>** <nowiki>Update to 2.2.0</nowiki> //<color #ccc>(</color><color #282>+3</color><color #ccc>,</color><color #f00>-3</color><color #ccc>)</color>//\\
\\
=== CVE-2014-9761 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.23 allow context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a long argument to the (1) nan, (2) nanf, or (3) nanl function.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2014-9761]]\\
**Commits:**\\
''[[https://git.lede-project.org/?p=source.git;a=commitdiff;h=4badb8a023bf187c235f1e558ab96c41729edbcb|4badb8a]]'' **<nowiki>glibc:</nowiki>** <nowiki>switch to 2.24 by default and remove old versions, fixes security issues</nowiki> //<color #ccc>(</color><color #282>+2</color><color #ccc>,</color><color #f00>-85</color><color #ccc>)</color>//\\
\\
=== CVE-2015-3202 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>fusermount in FUSE before 2.9.3-15 does not properly clear the environment before invoking (1) mount or (2) umount as root, which allows local users to write to arbitrary files via a crafted LIBMOUNT_MTAB environment variable that is used by mount's debugging feature.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-3202]]\\
**Commits:**\\
''[[https://git.lede-project.org/?p=source.git;a=commitdiff;h=4081333084a4e52a125f678e905dbbcccb9e4bd0|4081333]]'' **<nowiki>package/utils/fuse:</nowiki>** <nowiki>update to 2.9.7</nowiki> //<color #ccc>(</color><color #282>+5</color><color #ccc>,</color><color #f00>-74</color><color #ccc>)</color>//\\
\\
=== CVE-2015-7547 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in the (1) send_dg and (2) send_vc functions in the libresolv library in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.23 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted DNS response that triggers a call to the getaddrinfo function with the AF_UNSPEC or AF_INET6 address family, related to performing "dual A/AAAA DNS queries" and the libnss_dns.so.2 NSS module.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-7547]]\\
**Commits:**\\
''[[https://git.lede-project.org/?p=source.git;a=commitdiff;h=4badb8a023bf187c235f1e558ab96c41729edbcb|4badb8a]]'' **<nowiki>glibc:</nowiki>** <nowiki>switch to 2.24 by default and remove old versions, fixes security issues</nowiki> //<color #ccc>(</color><color #282>+2</color><color #ccc>,</color><color #f00>-85</color><color #ccc>)</color>//\\
\\
=== CVE-2015-8776 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>The strftime function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.23 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly obtain sensitive information via an out-of-range time value.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-8776]]\\
**Commits:**\\
''[[https://git.lede-project.org/?p=source.git;a=commitdiff;h=4badb8a023bf187c235f1e558ab96c41729edbcb|4badb8a]]'' **<nowiki>glibc:</nowiki>** <nowiki>switch to 2.24 by default and remove old versions, fixes security issues</nowiki> //<color #ccc>(</color><color #282>+2</color><color #ccc>,</color><color #f00>-85</color><color #ccc>)</color>//\\
\\
=== CVE-2015-8777 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>The process_envvars function in elf/rtld.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.23 allows local users to bypass a pointer-guarding protection mechanism via a zero value of the LD_POINTER_GUARD environment variable.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-8777]]\\
**Commits:**\\
''[[https://git.lede-project.org/?p=source.git;a=commitdiff;h=4badb8a023bf187c235f1e558ab96c41729edbcb|4badb8a]]'' **<nowiki>glibc:</nowiki>** <nowiki>switch to 2.24 by default and remove old versions, fixes security issues</nowiki> //<color #ccc>(</color><color #282>+2</color><color #ccc>,</color><color #f00>-85</color><color #ccc>)</color>//\\
\\
=== CVE-2015-8778 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>Integer overflow in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.23 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via the size argument to the __hcreate_r function, which triggers out-of-bounds heap-memory access.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-8778]]\\
**Commits:**\\
''[[https://git.lede-project.org/?p=source.git;a=commitdiff;h=4badb8a023bf187c235f1e558ab96c41729edbcb|4badb8a]]'' **<nowiki>glibc:</nowiki>** <nowiki>switch to 2.24 by default and remove old versions, fixes security issues</nowiki> //<color #ccc>(</color><color #282>+2</color><color #ccc>,</color><color #f00>-85</color><color #ccc>)</color>//\\
\\
=== CVE-2015-8779 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>Stack-based buffer overflow in the catopen function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.23 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a long catalog name.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2015-8779]]\\
**Commits:**\\
''[[https://git.lede-project.org/?p=source.git;a=commitdiff;h=4badb8a023bf187c235f1e558ab96c41729edbcb|4badb8a]]'' **<nowiki>glibc:</nowiki>** <nowiki>switch to 2.24 by default and remove old versions, fixes security issues</nowiki> //<color #ccc>(</color><color #282>+2</color><color #ccc>,</color><color #f00>-85</color><color #ccc>)</color>//\\
\\
=== CVE-2016-0718 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>Expat allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a malformed input document, which triggers a buffer overflow.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-0718]]\\

=== CVE-2016-1234 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>Stack-based buffer overflow in the glob implementation in GNU C Library (aka glibc) before 2.24, when GLOB_ALTDIRFUNC is used, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a long name.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-1234]]\\
**Commits:**\\
''[[https://git.lede-project.org/?p=source.git;a=commitdiff;h=4badb8a023bf187c235f1e558ab96c41729edbcb|4badb8a]]'' **<nowiki>glibc:</nowiki>** <nowiki>switch to 2.24 by default and remove old versions, fixes security issues</nowiki> //<color #ccc>(</color><color #282>+2</color><color #ccc>,</color><color #f00>-85</color><color #ccc>)</color>//\\
\\
=== CVE-2016-2105 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>Integer overflow in the EVP_EncodeUpdate function in crypto/evp/encode.c in OpenSSL before 1.0.1t and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2h allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap memory corruption) via a large amount of binary data.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-2105]]\\
**Commits:**\\
''[[https://git.lede-project.org/?p=source.git;a=commitdiff;h=f6adbdf3cdb8ce0d5a730575cab797ced956a59e|f6adbdf]]'' **<nowiki>openssl:</nowiki>** <nowiki>Update to version 1.0.2h</nowiki> //<color #ccc>(</color><color #282>+2</color><color #ccc>,</color><color #f00>-2</color><color #ccc>)</color>//\\
\\
=== CVE-2016-2106 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>Integer overflow in the EVP_EncryptUpdate function in crypto/evp/evp_enc.c in OpenSSL before 1.0.1t and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2h allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap memory corruption) via a large amount of data.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-2106]]\\
**Commits:**\\
''[[https://git.lede-project.org/?p=source.git;a=commitdiff;h=f6adbdf3cdb8ce0d5a730575cab797ced956a59e|f6adbdf]]'' **<nowiki>openssl:</nowiki>** <nowiki>Update to version 1.0.2h</nowiki> //<color #ccc>(</color><color #282>+2</color><color #ccc>,</color><color #f00>-2</color><color #ccc>)</color>//\\
\\
=== CVE-2016-2107 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>The AES-NI implementation in OpenSSL before 1.0.1t and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2h does not consider memory allocation during a certain padding check, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive cleartext information via a padding-oracle attack against an AES CBC session, NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incorrect fix for CVE-2013-0169.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-2107]]\\
**Commits:**\\
''[[https://git.lede-project.org/?p=source.git;a=commitdiff;h=f6adbdf3cdb8ce0d5a730575cab797ced956a59e|f6adbdf]]'' **<nowiki>openssl:</nowiki>** <nowiki>Update to version 1.0.2h</nowiki> //<color #ccc>(</color><color #282>+2</color><color #ccc>,</color><color #f00>-2</color><color #ccc>)</color>//\\
\\
=== CVE-2016-2109 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>The asn1_d2i_read_bio function in crypto/asn1/a_d2i_fp.c in the ASN.1 BIO implementation in OpenSSL before 1.0.1t and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2h allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a short invalid encoding.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-2109]]\\
**Commits:**\\
''[[https://git.lede-project.org/?p=source.git;a=commitdiff;h=f6adbdf3cdb8ce0d5a730575cab797ced956a59e|f6adbdf]]'' **<nowiki>openssl:</nowiki>** <nowiki>Update to version 1.0.2h</nowiki> //<color #ccc>(</color><color #282>+2</color><color #ccc>,</color><color #f00>-2</color><color #ccc>)</color>//\\
\\
=== CVE-2016-2176 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>The X509_NAME_oneline function in crypto/x509/x509_obj.c in OpenSSL before 1.0.1t and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2h allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from process stack memory or cause a denial of service (buffer over-read) via crafted EBCDIC ASN.1 data.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-2176]]\\
**Commits:**\\
''[[https://git.lede-project.org/?p=source.git;a=commitdiff;h=f6adbdf3cdb8ce0d5a730575cab797ced956a59e|f6adbdf]]'' **<nowiki>openssl:</nowiki>** <nowiki>Update to version 1.0.2h</nowiki> //<color #ccc>(</color><color #282>+2</color><color #ccc>,</color><color #f00>-2</color><color #ccc>)</color>//\\
\\
=== CVE-2016-3075 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>Stack-based buffer overflow in the nss_dns implementation of the getnetbyname function in GNU C Library (aka glibc) before 2.24 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (stack consumption and application crash) via a long name.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-3075]]\\
**Commits:**\\
''[[https://git.lede-project.org/?p=source.git;a=commitdiff;h=4badb8a023bf187c235f1e558ab96c41729edbcb|4badb8a]]'' **<nowiki>glibc:</nowiki>** <nowiki>switch to 2.24 by default and remove old versions, fixes security issues</nowiki> //<color #ccc>(</color><color #282>+2</color><color #ccc>,</color><color #f00>-85</color><color #ccc>)</color>//\\
\\
=== CVE-2016-3706 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>Stack-based buffer overflow in the getaddrinfo function in sysdeps/posix/getaddrinfo.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via vectors involving hostent conversion. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2013-4458.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-3706]]\\

=== CVE-2016-3739 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>The (1) mbed_connect_step1 function in lib/vtls/mbedtls.c and (2) polarssl_connect_step1 function in lib/vtls/polarssl.c in cURL and libcurl before 7.49.0, when using SSLv3 or making a TLS connection to a URL that uses a numerical IP address, allow remote attackers to spoof servers via an arbitrary valid certificate.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-3739]]\\

=== CVE-2016-4429 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>Stack-based buffer overflow in the clntudp_call function in sunrpc/clnt_udp.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows remote servers to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly unspecified other impact via a flood of crafted ICMP and UDP packets.</nowiki>

=== CVE-2016-4472 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>The overflow protection in Expat is removed by compilers with certain optimization settings, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via crafted XML data.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2015-1283 and CVE-2015-2716.</nowiki>

=== CVE-2016-4476 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>hostapd 0.6.7 through 2.5 and wpa_supplicant 0.6.7 through 2.5 do not reject \n and \r characters in passphrase parameters, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (daemon outage) via a crafted WPS operation.</nowiki>

=== CVE-2016-5195 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>Race condition in mm/gup.c in the Linux kernel 2.x through 4.x before 4.8.3 allows local users to gain privileges by leveraging incorrect handling of a copy-on-write (COW) feature to write to a read-only memory mapping, as exploited in the wild in October 2016, aka "Dirty COW."</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-5195]]\\
**Commits:**\\

=== CVE-2016-5300 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>The XML parser in Expat does not use sufficient entropy for hash initialization, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via crafted identifiers in an XML document.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2012-0876.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-5300]]\\

=== CVE-2016-5417 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>Memory leak in the __res_vinit function in the IPv6 name server management code in libresolv in GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.24 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) by leveraging partial initialization of internal resolver data structures.</nowiki>

=== CVE-2016-5419 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>curl and libcurl before 7.50.1 do not prevent TLS session resumption when the client certificate has changed, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended restrictions by resuming a session.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-5419]]\\

=== CVE-2016-5420 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>curl and libcurl before 7.50.1 do not check the client certificate when choosing the TLS connection to reuse, which might allow remote attackers to hijack the authentication of the connection by leveraging a previously created connection with a different client certificate.</nowiki>

**Link:** [[https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-5420]]\\
**Commits:**\\

=== CVE-2016-5696 ===
**Description:** <nowiki>net/ipv4/tcp_input.c in the Linux kernel before 4.7 does not properly determine the rate of challenge ACK segments, which makes it easier for remote attackers to hijack TCP sessions via a blind in-window attack.</nowiki>
